holidays.name: World Water Day
holidays.description: A global day dedicated to celebrating freshwater and raising awareness about the importance of sustainable management of water resources.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 1993 to highlight the importance of water and advocate for equitable access worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Despite covering about 71% of the Earth's surface, only 2.5% of the world's water is freshwater suitable for drinking!

holidays.name: International Goof Off Day
holidays.description: A lighthearted holiday where the goal is to be silly, procrastinate, and have fun instead of working hard.
holidays.origin: A playful unofficial holiday embraced by office workers and students to relieve stress and encourage fun sporadically.
holidays.funFact: On this day, being productive is discouraged‚Äîso don't be surprised if your coworkers suddenly become professional daydreamers!

holidays.name: National Supreme Sacrifice Day (USA)
holidays.description: A day to honor those who have made the ultimate sacrifice in the service of their country, particularly military members who died in battle.
holidays.origin: An unofficial U.S. observance to remember fallen soldiers and their families' sacrifices.
holidays.funFact: March 22 was chosen because it coincides closely with the anniversary of the Battle of Kasserine Pass during World War II.

holidays.name: National Bavarian Crepes Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to enjoy traditional Bavarian style crepes‚Äîthin pancakes often filled with sweet or savory ingredients.
holidays.origin: A food holiday that celebrates the rich culinary traditions of Bavaria, Germany.
holidays.funFact: Bavarian crepes are often served with a sprinkle of powdered sugar and a side of warm fruit compote‚Äîperfect for a cozy spring day!
